title: Rassie Erasmus praises 'absolute legend' Warren Gatland ahead of South Africa's semi-final clash with Wales
text:
South Africa boss Rassie Erasmus has hailed Wales head coach Warren Gatland as “an absolute legend” before their World Cup semi-final on Sunday while dismissing coaching mind games as “unnecessary nonsense”.

Erasmus has made one enforced changed from the side that beat Japan 26-3 in the quarter-final with Sbu Nkosi replacing star wing Cheslin Kolbe who is nursing an ankle injury. Erasmus also retains the same six forwards-two backs split on his replacements bench.

Unlike the tit-a-tat between Steve Hansen and Eddie Jones prior to the first semi-final of New Zealand versus England, Erasmus has no interest in prodding any hornets’ nest. You generally have to read the transcript of an Erasmus press...
